simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: In the section about great British inventions of the twentieth century, it states 
 to: In the section about great British inventions of the twentieth century, it says

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: British people think the top 1% wealthiest households own 59% of their countrys wealth, when they actually only own 23%.
 
 to: British people think the richest 1% own 59% of their countrys wealth, when they actually only own 23%.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Americans think that 33% of their population are immigrants, when in fact it is only 14%.
 
 to: Americans think that 33% of their population are immigrants but it is really only 14%.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: For example, most countries hugely overestimate how many people are not religious 
 to: For example, most countries overestimate how many people are not religious

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: This is because we are thinking of how many people practise their religion, rather than how many people see themselves as having a religion.
 
 to: This is because we are thinking of how many people practise their religion, rather than how many people say they have a religion.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: People are worried about these things and, because of this, they overestimate how big the problems are.
 
 to: People are worried about these things and, because of this, they overestimate.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: The worst case is Saudi Arabia, where people think only 28% are, when 71% are.
 
 to: The worst case is Saudi Arabia, where people think only 28% are overweight, when 71% are.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Britons think it is 44% when it is actually nearly half as much again  62% are either overweight or obese.
 
 to: Britons think it is 44%, when actually 62% are overweight.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: And, in many ways, it is not our misperceptions but these realities across different countries that are the most interesting and important aspects of the study.
 
 to: In many ways, it is the differences between countries that are the most interesting and important aspects of the study.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: He reduced the number of showers he had and did not use shampoo or soap when he had a shower.
 
 to: As part of his series, If Our Bodies Could Talk, Hamblin reduced the number of showers he had and did not use shampoo and soap when he had a shower.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Thats 65 litres of clean, drinkable water that were  lling with soap and washing down the drain each day  sometimes more than once.
 
 to: Thats 65 litres of clean, drinkable water that we  ll with soap and wash down the drain each and every day  sometimes more than once.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: The vital importance of clean water is becoming harder and harder to ignore, as California enters another summer of drought.
 
 to: The importance of clean water is becoming harder and harder to ignore  for example, there is another summer of drought in California.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Skip a few showers, put down the soap and let those lovely little bacteria  ourish a little. 
 
 to: Shower less, put down the soap and let those lovely little bacteria  ourish.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Many of us know we dont get enough sleep but imagine if we could  x it with a fairly simple solution 
 to: Many of us know we dont get enough sleep but imagine if there was a simple solution

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: In a speech at the British Science Festival, Dr Paul Kelley of the Sleep and Circadian Neuroscience Institute at Oxford University said schools should stagger their starting times to work with the natural biological rhythms of their students.
 
 to: In a speech at the British Science Festival, Dr Paul Kelley from Oxford University said schools should stagger their starting times to work with the natural rhythms of their students.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: It would improve cognitive performance, exam results and students health (lack of sleep can cause diabetes, depression, obesity and immune system problems).
 
 to: This would improve exam results and students health (lack of sleep can cause diabetes, depression, obesity and other health problems).

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: For the older teenagers, it might be more sensible to start the school day at 11am or even later.
 
 to: For the older teenagers, it might be better to start the school day at 11am or even later.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: He says the solution is not to persuade teenagers to go to bed earlier.
 
 to: He says the solution is not to tell teenagers to go to bed earlier.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Describing the average sleep loss per night for different age groups, he says 
 to: Describing the average sleep loss per night for different age groups, he says

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: For people aged between 24 and about 30 or 35, its about an hour and a half.
 
 to: For people aged between 24 and about 30 or 35, they lose about an hour and a half.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Kelley says that synchronized hours could have many positive consequences.
 
 to: Kelley says that synchronized hours could have many positive effects.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: The positive side of this is peoples performance, mood and health will improve.
 
 to: The positive side is that peoples performance, mood and health will improve.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Its very uplifting because its a solution that will make people less ill, and happier and better at what they do.
 
 to: Its very positive because its a solution that will make people less ill, and happier and better at what they do.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: There would probably be fewer accidents because drivers would be more alert, he says.
 
 to: There would probably be fewer accidents because drivers would be more awake, he says.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: And, yes, he says he  nds the start of his working day much easier now than he did when he was younger. 
 
 to: And, yes, he says he  nds the start of his working day much easier now than when he was younger.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: But even short  ights from a mobile landing pad could cause serious logistical problems, he said.
 
 to: But even short  ights from a mobile landing place could cause serious problems, he said.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Then, maybe theres construction equipment that wasnt there before but is there now.
 
 to: Maybe there will be construction equipment that wasnt there but is there now.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Maybe GPS signals are blocked, in which case its going to have an incorrect idea about where it is.
 
 to: Maybe GPS signals will be blocked so its going to have an incorrect idea about where it is.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: One major problem is maintaining radio contact with a drone and planning for what happens if that contact breaks.
 
 to: One big problem is keeping radio contact with a drone and planning for what happens if that contact breaks.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: If you have a vehicle that can go into a neighbourhood, it can deliver from that base.
 
 to: If you have a vehicle that can go into a neighbourhood, it can deliver from that vehicle.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: You need a 15-minute distance and typical off-the-shelf drones have that distance.
 
 to: You need a 15-minute distance, and typical drones have about that distance.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: The Reaper drone has one failure in 10,000 hours, Singh said.
 
 to: The Reaper drone, for example, has one failure in 10,000 hours, Singh said.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Part of the reason for this is that air travel is dangerous so standards are much higher.
 
 to: Part of the reason for this is simply that air travel is dangerous so standards are much higher.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Part of the solution, Singh said, is planning for every situation 
 to: Part of the solution, Singh said, is planning for every situation

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: This food helps them survive the cold, dark Long Island winter.
 
 to: The food helps them get through the cold, dark Long Island winter.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: The Hamptons are historic oceanfront towns and villages 100 miles from Manhattan.
 
 to: The Hamptons are historic, oceanfront towns and villages 100 miles from Manhattan, New York.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Vicki Littman is chairperson of the East Hampton Food Pantry, which provided more than 31,000 food parcels in 2015.
 
 to: Vicki Littman, chairperson of the East Hampton Food Pantry, which gave more than 31,000 food parcels in 2015, says there are more and more people coming to the food pantry.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Theres certainly a lot of wealth here but almost all of that wealth is in second homes only used in the summer, says Cantwell, the son of a  sherman father and a house-cleaner mother.
 
 to: Theres a lot of wealth here but almost all of that wealth is in second homes only used in the summer, says Cantwell, the son of a  sherman father and a house-cleaner mother.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: But, the rest of us live here year round.
 
 to: But, the rest of us live here all year.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: There are famous and very wealthy people but also hard-working and poor people who struggle to get by.
 
 to: There are famous and very wealthy people but also hard-working and poor people.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Youve got to remember that this community used to be a farming and  shing community of people who lived off the land and the water  a real working-class community.
 
 to: Youve got to remember that this used to be a farming and  shing community  a real working-class community.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Eddie Vallone, 22, says, People see the Hamptons as some sort of rich town but there are a lot of problems here, especially drugs.
 
 to: Eddie Vallone, 22, says, People only see the Hamptons as a rich town but there are a lot of problems here, especially drugs.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: I want to work but theres no work to do.
 
 to: Vallone says, I want to work but theres no work.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Some danced, some posed for photos, some drank, but mostly they just walked and talked football, waiting for the next game to begin on the nearby big screen.
 
 to: Some danced, some took photos, some drank, but mostly they just walked and talked about football, waiting for the next game to begin on the big screen nearby.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: The cheerful, largely peaceful mood was very different from the protests, transport chaos and stadium problems during the preparations for the World Cup.
 
 to: The friendly, mostly peaceful mood was very different from the protests, transport chaos and stadium problems during the preparations for the World Cup.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: But, now that were here, its great, said Brian Hill, an England fan from Sunderland.
 
 to: But, now that were here, its great, said Brian Hill, another England fan.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: His son, Andrew, had his sunglasses stolen almost as soon as he sat on the beach.
 
 to: His sons sunglasses were stolen almost as soon as he sat on the beach.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: But, like many fans, they said they loved the atmosphere of this tournament, which has got off to a spectacular start on the pitch.
 
 to: But, like many fans, they said they loved the atmosphere of this tournament, which has had a spectacular start.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Everyone must have been thrilled by Robin van Persies extraordinary diving header for the Netherlands against Spain.
 
 to: Everyone enjoyed Robin van Persies extraordinary diving header for the Netherlands against Spain.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: The stadiums may have been delivered late and  in some cases  not fully  nished, but there have been no reports of structural problems or dif culties entering the grounds since the kick off.
 
 to: The stadiums were delivered late and  in some cases  not fully  nished, but there  have been no structural problems or dif culties entering the grounds.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: FIFA spokesman Saint-Clair Milesi con rmed that only 48,000 of the 51,900 seats at the Netherlands versus Spain game were filled.
 
 to: FIFA spokesman Saint-Clair Milesi said that only 48,000 of the 51,900 seats were  lled at the game between the Netherlands and Spain.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Traf c was already bad but this week it is chaotic, said Jecilda Mello, a local resident.
 
 to: Traf c was already bad but this week it is chaotic, said Jecilda Mello, a local person.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: But, protests have diminished since the opening day, when small demonstrations took place in several cities and police used tear gas and pepper spray.
 
 to: But, protests have happened less often since the opening day, when small demonstrations took place in several cities and police used pepper spray.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Since then, the only security threat has been petty theft and overexcited fans.
 
 to: Since then, the only security problem has been petty theft and overexcited fans.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: The huge distances have led to some very different World Cup experiences.
 
 to: The huge distances have created some very different World Cup experiences.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: The tournament has made only a small mark on Sa_o Paulo, South Americas most populous city, but far away in Manaus  the remote Amazonian city where England played Italy  visitors said there was World Cup fever with brightly decorated streets and  ags on many cars.
 
 to: But, far away in Manaus  the remote Amazonian city where England played Italy  visitors said there was World Cup fever with brightly decorated streets and  ags on many cars.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: McDonalds is the worlds biggest burger chain and a global emblem of American consumer capitalism.
 
 to: McDonalds is the worlds biggest burger chain and a symbol of American consumer capitalism.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: But, these days, the golden arches of McDonalds are looking a little tarnished.
 
 to: But, these days, the golden arches of McDonalds are not looking so golden.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: In Europe, sales are down by 4%, mostly because of problems in Ukraine and the anti-western mood in Russia.
 
 to: In Europe, sales fell by 4%, mostly because of problems in Ukraine and the anti-western mood in Russia.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: But it is in the US, where McDonalds has around 40% of its restaurants, where the crisis is deepest.
 
 to: But the worst crisis is in the US, where McDonalds has around 40% of its restaurants.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: To add to the companys problems, McDonalds hamburgers were recently named the worst in America in a poll of more than 32,000 American diners, who said they would rather eat a burger at Five Guys, Smashburger or Fuddruckers.
 
 to: Another problem is that McDonalds hamburgers were recently named the worst in America in a poll of more than 32,000 American diners  they said they would rather eat a burger at Five Guys, Smashburger or Fuddruckers.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Have you ever used pink slime in your burgers?
 
 to: Someone asked Have you ever used pink slime in your burgers?

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Ever since it introduced $2 items on its dollar menu, it has gained a reputation for being more expensive than its rivals, while many consumers complain that service is slower.
 
 to: But, since it introduced $2 items on its dollar menu, people think it is more expensive than its rivals and many consumers complain that service is slower.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Prices have indeed gone up but they havent gone up as quickly as the rest of the fast-service chains in the US.
 
 to: Prices have gone up but they havent gone up as quickly as the rest of the fast-food chains in the US.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: McDonalds has a bigger menu than some, with more complicated items  its chicken McWrap takes 60 seconds to make.
 
 to: McDonalds has a bigger menu than some other restaurants, with more complicated items  its chicken McWrap takes 60 seconds to make.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Only four out of McDonalds 14,000 US restaurants had so far tested build your own burger, he said.
 
 to: Only four out of McDonalds 14,000 US restaurants have tested build your own burger, he said.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Thousands of people protested on Australias beaches against a shark cull that is being carried out in Western Australia.
 
 to: Thousands of people protested on Australias beaches against a shark cull in Western Australia.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: The catching and killing of sharks longer than three metres began after what the state government called an unprecedented number of shark attacks on Western Australias coast.
 
 to: Catching and killing sharks longer than three metres began after a number of shark attacks on Western Australias coast.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: However, the whole of Australia has had an average of just one shark-related death a year for the last 50 years.
 
 to: But the whole of Australia has had, on average, just one shark-related death a year for the last 50 years.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Kate Faehrmann, of the Sea Shepherd Conservation Society, said from a protest in the state capital, Perth 
 to: Kate Faehrmann, of the Sea Shepherd Conservation Society, said, from a protest in Perth, the state capital of Western Australia

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Faehrmann said the protests had shown that Australians wanted sharks protected 
 to: Faehrmann said the protests showed that Australians wanted sharks to be protected

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: The state government has refused to say how many sharks have been killed, though there have been reports of sharks smaller than three metres being released after getting caught on drumlines,  oating drums  xed to the sea bed with bait hanging on hooks underneath them.
 
 to: The state government will not say how many sharks they have killed, but some people say that sharks smaller than three metres were released after they were caught on drumlines,  oating drums  xed to the sea bed with bait on hooks underneath them.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Conservationists say there is no evidence the cull will reduce the number of shark attacks on humans, because no previous cull has only used drumlines.
 
 to: Conservationists say there is no evidence the cull will reduce the number of shark attacks on humans, because no other cull has only used drumlines.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Researchers at the University of Western Australia say the increased number of shark attacks in the state is probably because the state has the fastest-growing population in Australia, not because of a rising number of sharks.
 
 to: Researchers at the University of Western Australia say the increased number of shark attacks in the state may be because Western Australia has the fastest-growing population in Australia, not because of a rising number of sharks.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Richard Peirce, of the UK-based conservation charity, the Shark Trust, said that the cull would be ineffective and could bring more predators towards the coast.
 
 to: Richard Peirce, of the UK-based conservation charity, the Shark Trust, said that the cull would not work and could bring more predators towards the coast.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: The activity in Western Australia is compounding the human tragedy of shark attacks.
 
 to: The activity in Western Australia is adding to the human tragedy of shark attacks.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Richard Branson said the policy was not working.
 
 to: Richard Branson said the idea was not working.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: All youre going to achieve, I think, is to worry people unnecessarily. 
 
 to: All youre going to achieve, I think, is to worry people.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: More than one million British workers might be employed on zero-hours contracts, a new poll shows.
 
 to: More than one million British workers might be employed on zero-hours contracts.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: The retailers use of the contracts was followed by details of many other companies using the contracts, including cinema chain Cineworld and Buckingham Palace, which uses them for its 350 summer workers.
 
 to: Other companies using the contracts include cinema chain Cineworld and Buckingham Palace, which uses the contracts for its 350 summer workers.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Dave Prentis, of the trade union Unison, said 
 to: Dave Prentis, of the trade union Unison, said

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: Workers on zero-hours contracts are often only told how many hours they will work when weekly or monthly rotas are created, but are expected to be on call for extra work at short notice.
 
 to: Workers on zero-hours contracts are often only told how many hours they will work when weekly or monthly rotas are created.

simplify the text to elementary: 
 text: The charity National Trust, which employs many of its seasonal workers on zero-hours contracts, said it offered the same pay and bene ts to those workers, pro rata, as full-time staff, but needed some workers to be on more  exible contracts.
 
 to: The charity National Trust, which employs many of its seasonal workers on zero-hours contracts, said it gives the same pay and bene ts to workers on zero-hours contracts as to full-time staff.
